name: Cricklade House Hotel & Country Club

reviews.text: I had the pleasure of staying a week at this charming hotel during a recent business trip. It exceeded all my expectations. The service was second to none and the staff bent over backwards to ensure that my needs were met. I especially enjoyed the beautiful views from the lounge and restaurant areas. My room was a fairly good size, clean, and well maintained. The food was very good and the only complaint would be the pricey bar prices (as mentioned by other reviewers). I would definately stay there again and would highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Incredible service, Great Food and Charming atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was spotless and grounds well kept. Staff attentive without being overbearing. Evening meal and breakfast excellent. Huge room with a four poster. Bar drinks and wine list very overpriced.
reviews.title: Excellent, not just for golfers.

reviews.text: We stayed as a party of eight for the weekend, mostly just eating, drinking and spending time with old friends. The hotel is excellent for this, and, no doubt, for more energetic souls, for whom there are numerous opportunities for exercise (e.g. golf, gym, snooker/pool, swimming etc.). The lounge and large conservatory have beautiful views and are luxuriously comfortable and homely. All the public spaces are very well maintained.
reviews.title: Perfect for getting together with friends

reviews.text: We had courtyard rooms, which were very quiet and convenient, being only yards away from the main building. They were beautifully kept, though just beginning to show signs of tiredness here and there. Housekeeping standards are very high, efficient and unobtrusive.
reviews.title: Wow, just perfect, stunning setting, very opulent

likes.liked: — the luxury feel, the location, relaxing on the terracing with a drink with those views
likes.disliked: — a few people complained that every room had a firm bed and the hotel could do with a bigger sign at the entrance off the road as I missed it !! but I'm nitpicking

reviews.text: The menu and food were very good and the "front of house" service the best I have ever encountered. If staying for several days, one might wish for a more extensive menu to choose from or, perhaps, daily specials to add variety.
reviews.title: Still as good as last year!

reviews.text: I was attending a weekend course in nearby Cricklade and chose a hotel where my wife could relax whilst I was away on the course. We stayed for two nights. The room was comfortable, of a good size and had great views over the countryside. My wife enjoyed the swimming pool and the leisure facilities and we both enjoyed the hearty breakfast and evening dinner in the restaurant. As I am attending another course in March 2013, I have re-booked this hotel - again for two nights.
reviews.title: Very Enjoyable Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Firstly, if you're a light sleeper or have back problems don't bother. The mattresses are dire and you would be better off sleeping on the floor. All the spring dig in your back and they are unbelievably uncomfortable.
reviews.title: A little tired, but great facilities

reviews.text: The hotel is tired, cracks and scuffs in the wall, stained carpet, grouting coming out of the tiles, pool tiles and ceiling stained etc.
reviews.title: Had a lovely stay at this hotel

reviews.text: However, what won us over was the gorgeous breakfast, the friendly and helpful staff and the great facilities - we particularly enjoyed the steam room and the snooker room.
reviews.title: Great stay, lovely setting and delicious food

reviews.text: The bar area has a wonderful atmosphere and the drinks are fairly priced.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, a little tired in places.

reviews.text: Attended a Christmas party at the hotel. It was clearly very busy that night with similar events but be service was pretty good with courses arriving quickly.
reviews.title: Christmas party

reviews.text: Starters were ok, although I didn't really enjoy my white onion velouté but that is probably my taste buds as it was well made. Turkey main course was good with nice vegetables on the side. Chocolate tart for dessert was the highlight, really rich and delicious. Mince pies with coffee were bought in which was a shame.
reviews.title: couldnt fault xmas day lunch

reviews.text: DJ was playing a good selection of music, not your usual party tunes.
reviews.title: Christmas Day Lunch

reviews.text: Compared with one Christmas party nights this was definitely better than average.
reviews.title: Great views but rock hard beds

reviews.text: Took My Parents out for xmas lunch here and the experiance was a very good one indeed.
reviews.title: Customer service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I took a mini-break deal to the Cricklade hotel and country club over the May Bank Holiday. First impressions felt like this was a tired English style hotel. Its last re-décor would have been done in the 90s, which included the staff's uniforms and approach. The hotel was obviously more used to having weddings than weekend guests.
reviews.title: grew on me as time went on

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our rate was 2 nights B&B with dinner on the 1st evening. We reserved dinner at reception after being told it was "extremely busy" and took an early 7pm sitting. I was very frustrated to see notices up saying "no jeans" which in 2010 is quite ridiculous I think. Fortunately the hotel were accommodating as jeans were the only evening-wear my husband had brought, but there was still a bit of a "stuffy" feel.
reviews.title: Not an experience to repeat!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For dinner we were sat in the lounge and had a drink and were offered delicious appetizers from the friendly host who was in an over-dressed tuxedo. You could have heard a pin drop, there was no background music or lul of other guests - one other couple for the 7pm sitting - and my husband and I were aftraid to talk. We were seated in the conservatory area of the diningroom with beautiful views and enjoyed the most delicious meal we have had in a while. Chefs compliments, top quality 3 courses and enjoyed our coffee in the conservatory lounge (again afraid to talk). Throughout dinner we were waiting on the "very busy" hit of guests, and many couples came and went, but not to the level we had expected.
reviews.title: Wow what a hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The following day we enjoyed relaxing in the pool, which was clean and simple, and after driving about the area decided to eat in the hotel again on the second evening and were not disappointed by the high standard of food once again. We managed an 8.30pm sitting this time and did feel a little more comfortable with the hum of people in the lounge.
reviews.title: Great value for a special occasion

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was very nice, the bedroom minimal, but clean and comfortable. All in all a very quiet and relaxing break and nicely calm. The food is just excellent and rescued the whole weekend. The hotel staff are extremely friendly, but management just need a better idea on ways to bring the hotel into the 21st century, which I think can be very easily done, while maintaining the Cotswolds Charm.
reviews.title: pleasant weekend retreat in the inexpensive category

reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for a night thanks to a travelzoo deal, which included B&B and dinner for 2.
reviews.title: Excellent, could do with a refurb

reviews.text: Staff were very friendly throughout our stay, the room was a reasonable size, comfy bed, everything very clean.
reviews.title: Gorgeous hotel missing something.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dinner was exceptional, considering it was included in the offer, we weren't expecting to much, but it certainly exceeded our expectation, and I'd say it would be worth coming to the Cricklade House Hotel for the dining experience only.
reviews.title: Short break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfest was of an equally high standard, one of the best we've had in the UK.
reviews.title: Return visit and will do so again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool and spa area could do with a refurb, stained ceilings aren't too becoming for what is supposed to be a classy hotel. Rooms also looked a bit dated.
reviews.title: Little Gem with amazing food and 5* service

reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights whilst visiting the Cheltenham race festival and had a very pleasant stay.
reviews.title: Great location for Cheltenham Festival
Lovely Mothers Day
reviews.text: The rooms were clean with crisp white sheets and comfortable beds making for a very good nights sleep. Bathroom had large fluffy white towels but I was a bit disappointed with the power of the water from the ECO shower. The food served in the restaurant was very good indeed well presented and full of flavour. All staff very helpful and friendly with check in and out very swift.

Nice Mothers Day lunch, staff very attentive, food was nice, good atmosphere, thanks to all. Very busy but service was good and would go again. Such a lovely location, nice to sit and have coffee in the conservatory after lunch and enjoy the view. Not all party enjoyed their meal but did not spoil a nice day, would recommend for special occasions, we went at Christmas and had a lovely time. Bar service was good even tough there were lots of people in the bar.
reviews.title: Wedding Stay

reviews.text: Recently had a 2 day stay for a Wedding. The Wedding was wonderful, beautiful function room, excellent food and faultless service.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay - great service

reviews.text: Breakfast service on the first morning was very slow, waiting half an hour for a cooked breakfast and so was everyone else by the general grumbling that was going on.
reviews.title: Wedding of the year

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have visited Cricklade Hotel and Country Club every year since 2001, and it just gets better! The staff make this hotel - you are treated as true guests, not customers. We stayed this time for four nights on a dinner bed and breakfast basis at a very good rate. The food is quite outstanding and all the little touches i.e. canapes, appetisers and petits fours just add to the experience. We will certainly return.
reviews.title: Another great visit to our favourite hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A really lovely welcoming hotel. Very pleasant, helpful friendly staff. Really excellent food.
reviews.title: Very friendly hotel!

reviews.text: We had a double room but after the first night I asked to swap to a twin as the double only had a 4'6 bed and it was a little too cosy!! They moved us to a much bigger room that was lovely. The swimming pool was nice, really warm. The only downside was the lounge/bar are was very very quiet, usually only us and one or two other couples in the evening. There was a large group of youngish people on the last night and I thought "oh good a bit of life" but they chose to go out for the evening! May have been the bar prices as they were pretty steep. I think they would do well to have a bit of music and lower the drinks prices to encourage people to stay in the evening. It was a really nice place though.
reviews.title: Putting the record straight

reviews.text: Having read the reviews on this website I thought I should put the record straight about what is a lovely hotel. Set in a very quiet location outside Cricklade the hotel is very easy to find. We stayed for three nights on a dinner bed and breakfast basis and it was extremely good value for money. The service everywhere was excellent. Wireless internet access is available in the main hotel. The main hotel is lovely with a beautiful conservatory for both drinks and dinner. Everything was clean and well kept. We had two rooms in the annexes across the courtyard. Both rooms were huge. One was a double and the other a double + a single. This suited my teenage boys down to the ground. My son is allergic to blankets and without hesitation two duvets were provided for his bed. Nothing was too much trouble for anyone. The swimming pool is warm and in addition there is a snooker/pool room which my teenage sons loved. Dinner was wonderful on all three nights, with excellent service. Breakfasts are worth a mention as in addition to the normal fruit and full English there was fish, scotch pancakes and chocolate sauce and ham and eggs. There are only two things that I think could be improved. The dinner menu was the same for the three nights which might have got boring if we stayed any longer- but the food was just lovely. There is also a strange dress code of no jeans or T shirts on the bar and restaurant but some people ignore it and it seemed outdated when you can eat in a Michelin starred restaurant in jeans. I would definitely come back here again
reviews.title: Great service, okay food, no idea about the rooms

reviews.text: Four of us tried out the Cricklade Hotel for the first time for Sunday lunch. The grounds were pleasant (once we actually found the entrance, which we drove straight past at first because it is "understated"!) and the hotel building was pleasing. Views from inside were also very good, looking out over rolling grass and trees, albeit admittedly a lot of the grass was part of the attached golf course.
reviews.title: Appalling from all aspects - AVOID

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel at the end of November as all the other hotels in the Swindon area were booked.
reviews.title: Avoid room 19

reviews.text: As per an earlier review, the plumbing in room 19 is atrocious. One would have better success taking a shower under a slobbering St. Bernard than with the situation in this room. The plumbing issue however does not seem to extend to the bath taps or sink.
reviews.title: Don't book Room 19

reviews.text: On contacting the hotel staff, I was moved to another room which is directly next to room 19 (21) which did not have this problem and is apportioned much better than this room.
reviews.title: Fab!!
could be great
reviews.text: It is a pity that there appears to be an inconsistency in the quality of rooms in this hotel. Whilst the rest of the facilities seem nice as far as my experience shows it's hit and miss

aka: Cricklade House Hotel And Country Club
description: Standing in over 30 acres of peaceful, secluded grounds on the edge of the Cotswolds, the privately-owned Cricklade Hotel & Country Club offers a traditional, warm and friendly welcome for those in search of tranquility, comfort, good food and wine, with extensive recreational facilities.
